pageContext.description:
A copper alloy Early Bronze Age flat axehead dating to the period c. 2050 - 1450 BC. The axehead has a rounded butt which exhibits some old damage. It exhibits a lenticular profile. It widens along its length from 12.41mm at the butt end to 25.82mm at the blade end. The blade is rounded and the edge is incomplete due to old damage. The axehead exhibits a shiny dark green patina with a number of scratch marks on both sides. There are no casting seams visible.



The axehead exhibits similarities to Midgdale and Hopton type axes.



It measures 52.91mm in length, 12.41mm minimum width, 25.82mm maximum width, 2.68mm minimum width, 5.17mm maximum thickness and weighs 20.82g.
